data.question: What is the chemical formula for the cubane clusters mentioned in the text?
What is the BET surface area of CTGU-15?
What are the two metals mentioned that can form the cubane clusters in MOFs?
What is the optimal hybrid catalyst composition for methanol oxidation mentioned in the text?
What is the peak current density of the optimal hybrid catalyst at low potential?
What is the purpose of using ketjen black (KB) in the hybrid catalyst?
data.answer: To enhance the efficiency of the methanol oxidation reaction

data.question: Why are Ni-based nanomaterials considered promising candidates for electrochemical MOR?
data.answer: Due to their potential as efficient, durable, and inexpensive alternatives to Pt-based catalysts

data.question: How does the pore-space partition feature of CTGU-15 contribute to its application in electrocatalysis?
data.answer: It facilitates the adsorption/diffusion of reaction species, enhancing electrocatalytic activity

data.question: What role does the [Ni4(OH)4] cluster play in the structure of CTGU-15?
data.answer: It acts as a building unit, linking with TATB ligands to generate a porous net

data.question: Why is the integration of cubane [M4(OH)4] clusters into MOFs significant?
data.answer: It offers a method to enhance materials properties, especially for electrocatalytic applications

data.question: What is the effect of methanol concentration on the MOR performance of CTGU-15?
data.answer: The peak current density increases linearly with methanol concentration up to a certain point, indicating diffusion of reaction species plays a vital role

data.question: How does the double-ligand pore-space partition mode benefit CTGU-15?
data.answer: It provides high stability, which is desirable for electrocatalytic applications
